direction.raw_text: . The colored shapes dart around the screen -- the impression of looking through a kaleidoscope. As the image comes into sharp focus, we discover that we are inside a CANDY BOWL.  A MAN'S FINGERS are frantically removing all the cherry-flavored pieces of candy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man performing this curious task is writer/producer/director, VIKTOR TARANSKY, forties, conservatively dressed in suit and tie.  He sits alone at an empty craft service table outside a cavernous soundstage, some distance from the rest of the film set -- a breeze blows the table's paper cloth. Viktor finishes sorting.  Finding no trash can to deposit the rejected cherry candy, he scoops them into his pocket. A young headset-clad P.A. hurriedly approaches.  He looks ill. P.A. Mr. Taransky -- Viktor reads the young P.A.'s panicked expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's walking?... Don't tell me she's walking. (blood slowly draining from his face) She is not walking... She can't walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: twenty-something, A-list actress, beautiful face scowling, is supervising her ASSISTANT ferrying clothes from a movie trailer to a limousine.  VIKTOR desperately follows after Nicola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicola!  How was your massage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in breach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this about the new pages? -- I made the changes you wanted, you're in virtually every scene -- NICOLA (wheeling on him) It's not the size of the role, Viktor. (suddenly very cool) Am I or am I not contractually entitled to the biggest trailer on the set?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the biggest on earth!  I swear!  It's a 50-foot Airstream -- they don't make them any longer than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taller, Viktor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taller?  What? Viktor looks up in horror.  The trailer next to Nicola's does indeed appear to be fractionally taller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've insulted me for the last time. Viktor looks to the tires.  His face suddenly brightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicola, it's just the tires -- they're over-inflated!  I can fix it! Viktor grasps the air nozzle on a tire and begins desperately stabbing at it with a ballpoint pen.  Air hisses out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, it's lower already. Nicola ignores Viktor, marching towards her limo with her
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (regarding the enormous silver fish behind them, confused)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Abandoning the trailer, Viktor hurries after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg you.  You can't do this to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had three other offers.  I only signed on to this picture out of... loyalty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then show some.  They'll shut me down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't working anyhow.  The scene with the thousand geese -- I don't understand this film.  I don't think anyone will understand it.  I already put out a press release -- citing "creative differences". Viktor stops, nods resignedly -- suddenly very calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what, Nicola, you're right. (picking up her last piece of luggage) Here, let me help you with that. (holding the door for her) You ought to go.  The truth is I don't deserve you.  This film doesn't deserve you.  Frankly, it deserves much, much better.  The reason it's not working is because you're not about the work. Nicola is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Hell, please. The door slams and the limo roars away.  Viktor looks to the still hissing trailer tire.  The CREW regards Viktor apprehensively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking at?  Get back to work. The crew is uncertain what work there is to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "SUNRISE, SUNSET" - NIGHT In an ornate bedroom, NICOLA lies on her death bed under a veil of netting.  A distraught man, HAL, sits close by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack... are you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here.  I'm right beside you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should really go now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's alright.  Please, let him stay. The nun withdraws.  Hal holds his face in his hands, almost breaking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of cruel God is it that would take you away from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same one who brought me to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I cannot accept it.  If something like this can happen. What... (struggling to find the words) What is it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here. Nicola dies peacefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits with leading man HAL, THREE EXECUTIVES and studio head ELAINE CHRISTIAN, watching a rough assembly of the film. It ends with a close up of NICOLA ANDERS. The lights go up.  The image of Nicola fades off the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's good.  You can hardly tell she's reading off a teleprompter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've analyzed the footage.  We've got almost everything we need in the can.  If we rework the script, we can finish the film without her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to the writ her attorneys filed at noon today.  They'll sue if the film is released with Nicola in a single frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we'll re-cast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicola Anders is the only actress who can play that role.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a re-make, Hal.  Anders is not bigger than this picture. Elaine finally speaks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course she is.  No other name is going to sign on now and risk offending her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't need a name.  We'll cast an unknown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't play opposite an unknown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't sell an unknown.  Nicola's soured on the project and we have to accept that.  If we ever want to be in the Nicola Anders business again, we have to cut our losses and shelve the picture. The executives, leading man and director nod sagely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  You will not give in to that blackmailing bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse us. Elaine ushers Viktor out of the screening room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and VIKTOR talk in the shadow of an enormous soundstage.  They speak more freely in each other's company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, Viktor.  Why do you always have to make things so difficult for yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Difficult.  I'm difficult. He produces a handful of candy from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what these are, Elaine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm... Mike and Ike's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just any Mike & Ike's -- cherry Mike & Ike's.  Do you know why I, Viktor Taransky, two-time Academy Award nominated director -- ELAINE -- Viktor, that was Short Subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: overseeing the most cherished movie project of my career, am walking around with a pocketful of cherry Mike & Ike's? Elaine takes a seat in a nearby studio cart as Viktor paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a feeling you're going to tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you why.  It is because Miss Nicola Anders, supermodel with a SAG card God's gift to cinema, has it written into her contract that all cherry Mike & Ike's be removed from her candy dish along with strict instructions that any room she walks into should have seven packs of cigarettes waiting for her three of them opened, that there be a personal jacuzzi within eighty paces of her dressing room, and that any time she travels, her nanny must fly with her first class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elaine, she doesn't have any children! (grabbing her arm) Don't you see?  We're being held hostage by 12 men and 5 women who someone somewhere has decreed are the A-list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The public decides who's on that list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the truth.  Those 17 superstars are our insurance policy.  We can't open -- can't make a profit without them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can hardly make a profit with them.  Up-front salary, back-end deal, perks, per diem, percentages -- They're mocking us, Elaine. We're at their mercy. (staring wistful, into space) We always had movie stars but they used to be our stars.  We used to decide who would play what role. We told them what to wear, what to say, who to date.  When they were under contract, we could change their names if we wanted to -- more than once!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You realize you're nostalgic for an era you weren't even born in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I do remember why I started out in this business -- you seem to have forgotten -- working in New York with Cassevetes -- we were trying to do something important, shine a light in that darkened cinema -- ELAINE (rolling her eyes)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called a projector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Illuminate hearts and minds with a ray of truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Viktor, I have good memories of those days too -- but this isn't about that or you or me or some high-minded ideal.  This is business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spare me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, Viktor, look around. What do you think pays for all this?  This is about investment and return.  Those days in New York... that's... it's over. A pause.  Viktor reads Elaine's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not renewing my contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I?  Your last three pictures tanked.  The board is giving me hell.  No bankable star will work with you after this.  If you just compromised... a little. Viktor eats some of the candy in his hand as he takes in the news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's not every day you're fired by the mother of your own child. Elaine also eats some more candy -- a curiously intimate moment between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not taking away your daughter, just your deal.  You and I both know, after the divorce I kept you on for old time's sake, so you could still hold your head up in front of Lainey.  I called what's his name at Warner's.  He said he'd take a meeting -- in July.  I've fought for you Viktor... (voice trails off) You want to talk severance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can have everything -- office, car, assistants -- all I want is the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The picture's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there's no problem -- I can have the rights, the negative too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're yours.  But how are you going to finish it?  Without a star there's no movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need a star.  All I need is an actor -- I'll reshoot the part, cut out Nicola and replace her with a real actor.  A real leading lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if you find her, you know the problem with unknowns, Viktor.  If they're good, they get known.  And then you're back to sorting their candy... and worse. (kissing him on the cheek as she departs in her studio golf cart) I'm sorry, Viktor. Viktor watches her depart down the canyon of stages, left alone on the deserted lot.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (talking a piece of candy and eating it)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring off into the distance, face hardening)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Twenty NICOLA ANDERS' FACES jiggle into frame.  VIKTOR's face appears amongst them. They are cardboard figures, standing together in the trailer of an electric cart.  A WORKMAN is collecting the promotional standees from around the lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: places his hands on the neck of a cardboard cut-out -- we sense he is about to rip her head off -- when a fourteen year old girl, LAINEY, appears beside him, carrying a laptop computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, sweetheart. Viktor, embarrassed by his childishness, steps aside for the suspicious workman who carries the standee away. Lainey smiles sweetly.  She hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry Mom canned you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really... not anything, Lainey.  It's just -- LAINEY Don't feel too bad. (glancing to a standee) Mom runs the place and they still walk all over her.  You're better off out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look very grown up.  What are you doing?  You meeting your mom for dinner? She glances towards the entrance where Lainey's mother,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and her dependable, uncomplicated businessman boyfriend, KENT, wait beside Elaine's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kent got tickets to the ballet. Viktor shakes the idea of Kent and Elaine from his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to finish the picture, sweetheart.  It's important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you'll do it, Dad.  You're Viktor Taransky. Lainey kisses the forlorn Viktor goodbye.  She runs to her mother and Kent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.  I'm Viktor Taransky.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to convince himself as much as Lainey)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From a distance ELAINE and KENT regard the lonely figure of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had no choice, Elaine.  He's a liability.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He also happens to be the most talented man I've ever known. Elaine climbs in the car as Lainey approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP on a copy of "Variety".  The front page banner headline: "ANDERS RIDES OUT OF 'SUNSET' -- Cites Creative Differences" The man reading the trade paper sits in the back of a tram on a studio tour -- HANK ALENO.  He wears a pair of spectacles with one lens blacked out, his head tilted on one side.  It is an item buried on the inside pages that catches Hank's one good eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tram pauses.  The TOUR GUIDE keeps up a commentary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your left, the house where Claris Commodore uttered those now immortal words, "If that door doesn't hold, stand behind me". And coming up on your right -- When the tram departs, we discover that Hank has exited the tram and is hiding in the facade of a New York subway entrance.  The tag around his neck reads, "VISITOR -- Stay With The Tour".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheels a stack of film cans on a dolly while holding several framed black and white photographs of screen legends under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hiding in the shadows of the soundstages, spies Viktor. He hurries towards him as Viktor approaches his antiquated Bentley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Taransky, Mr. Taransky... thank God.  I've been trying to see you, calling -- Your assistant wouldn't put me through.  I told her it was a matter of life and death.  I was afraid I wouldn't get to you in time -- VIKTOR (using his stack of film cans as a barrier)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, get away from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did it, Mr. Taransky.  I licked skin.  I licked hair.  I licked every part of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to call Security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have her, Mr. Taransky.  The answer to your prayers. (producing the "Variety" article, conspiratorial) The answer to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was misquoted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have your new leading lady... (indicating the bulge in his pocket) ... right here in my pants. Viktor takes a step back, concerned once again about the man's motives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me, Mr. Taransky.  Don't you recognize me? -- The Future of Film conference in San Jose. Hank... Hank Aleno.  I was keynote speaker.  You must remember my speech... "Who Needs Humans?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.  You were booed off the stage.  That's got to be -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight years ago.  In that whole time, I never left my computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good for you, Hank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good and bad.  They think that's what caused this.  Me eye tumor. Microwaves from the screen.  It's the size of a grapefruit.  Heavy too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be.  It was worth it. Hank once again indicated the bulge in his pocket.  Viktor now understands the significance of the gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen them all before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not like this -- VIKTOR (patronizing smile) Come on, Hank.  A synthespian, virtual actor -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We call them "vactors".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need flesh and -- HANK -- Flesh is weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a living, breathing actor -- I can't work with a fake. Viktor loads his film cans into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You already do.  But my actor won't get old, fat, lazy or drunk -- won't throw tantrums, demand a body double, script changes or a bigger trailer. (whispers, conspiratorial) The Disney Corporation has been using artificial actors for years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the point, Hank.  No matter how good they are, they're still Mickey Mouse.  Everyone's tried. Everyone's failed.  It can't be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can -- with my new computer code, you and me, we can do it together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything about computers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why you're so perfect.  You have something I don't have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An eye -- for performance.  You know the truth when you see it.  I know.  I've seen your movies.  I love your movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Straw God" changed my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen every frame of your work. You're the only filmmaker in Hollywood with the artistic integrity to realize my vision. You and me, art and science... we are the perfect marriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Hank, it's been a rough day. (climbing into his car) I'll call you about his next week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be here next week.  The tumor's inoperable.  I'll be dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm already dead. Viktor's car roars away.  He looks back at the forlorn Hank in the rear view mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me. (looking at his watch) This week! A huge eye from a dismantled Nicola Anders billboard is wheeled away behind him -- followed by a huge pair of lips.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (more disturbed, fearing he is dealing with a pervert)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (regarding the pathetic figure with the tilted head)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A sea of ingenue headshots.  Black X's are drawn through all of them.  VIKTOR lies amongst the rejected faces, talking on the telephone, in his spartan bachelor beach house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean she won't work with me?  She's done nothing.  She doesn't have a single credit -- AGENT'S VOICE (from phone, off-camera)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better no credits than a Taransky credit.  No young actress is going to step into Nicola Anders' shoes and risk ending her career before it's even started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Art, you don't understand.  I've mortgaged everything to finish this film -- creditors calling, coming to the house, for God's sake, I need this -- The phone goes dead.  Viktor tries to re-dial -- disconnected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. Sharp knock on his door.  Viktor peers through a curtain and spies an official-looking MAN IN A SUIT, carrying what looks to be a legal notice in his hands. Viktor slips out of the back door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone, referring to a young woman's headshot)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hurries along the beach.  When he turns, he discovers the MAN IN THE SUIT following him.  As Viktor runs, the Suit runs -- calling out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Taransky, Mr. Taransky -- VIKTOR (calling back) I'm not him. Viktor stumbles.  When he recovers, the Suit is on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Taransky, Sir, I represent the estate of Mr. Hank Aleno. (showing him Hank's obituary in the L.A. Times) It was Mr. Aleno's last wish that you have this. The Suit hands Viktor a heavily-sealed envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea, Sir.  He wanted you to have it. The Suit departs.  Viktor hesitates, then breaks the seal on the package -- inside he finds a hard-drive.  The hard-drive is labeled "SIMULATION ONE".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP ON a VACUUM CLEANER cleaning a tatty red carpet. On the other end of the vacuum cleaner is VIKTOR.  The red carpet leads to a rundown, downtown Los Angeles cinema -- the venue for the premiere of "SUNRISE, SUNSET".  To save money on posters, Viktor has altered the originals, "Starring
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A TITLE APPEARS ON THE SCREEN

direction.raw_text: crudely pasted over with "Introducing SIMONE".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: regards the sad, little premiere.  No paparazzi, no limos, no klieg lights.  Resorting to giving away tickets to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viktor approaches a HOMELESS MAN sleeping in trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to see a free movie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. A taxi pulls up.  Viktor's daughter, LAINEY, steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Lainey. Viktor goes to pay for the taxi but doesn't have quite enough cash.  Lainey pays herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother couldn't make it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's at the premiere of "A Cold Day In Hell".  But I think she send someone from Acquisitions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She still with Kent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This week anyhow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: escorts Lainey down the empty red carpet, regarding the pathetic premiere.  As they walk by, the bulb in Viktor's sole spotlight expires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not quite how I imagined it -- LAINEY (looking on the bright side)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finished the film on your own terms, that's what matters. Did you really do all the post yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was no other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed you.  I wondered if you were ever coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can't wait to meet Simone... what's her last name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I... don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she here tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't watch herself. They are interrupted by the THEATER OWNER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we have to start.  I've got "Tough Love 2" playing at ten.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (regarding the makeshift poster, trying to lift his spirits)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: "SUNRISE, SUNSET" - MORNING A foggy, empty pier.  A MAN is running through the mist, shouting desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valarie!  VALARIE! Finally, out of the fog -- a young woman in a black cape and hood, her back to us.  The camera pushes in, music swells and she turns.  SIMONE.  She is exquisitely, ethereally beautiful.  Perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the near-empty, dilapidated theater, "SUNRISE, SUNSET" is playing ON THE SCREEN. When Simone's face appears, the faces of the AUDIENCE MEMBERS change.  They are all visibly moved, including the THEATER OWNER.  Some weeping, some with curious smiles on their faces, some opened-mouthed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valarie, what are you running from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Valarie. Suddenly a GUNSHOT rings out.  Simone collapses to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valarie!  No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: unable to watch, paces up and down, chain-smoking while worriedly shoving popcorn in his mouth.  Viktor finally musters the courage to look inside the auditorium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "SUNRISE, SUNSET" - NIGHT The same scene that played in the studio screening room. However now when we cut from the leading man, HAL, to the leading lady it is not NICOLA but the newly cast SIMONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are we here?  Is that what you're asking, Jack?... Why are we here?  No why.  Just here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lies dying.  Now even LAINEY is affected by Simone's performance.  She wipes a tear from her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches the backs of the heads, trying to gauge the audience reaction.  Finally the credits roll. A dedication, "For HANK". No one moves from their seats.  Viktor permits himself a brief smile of satisfaction as he sees his name appear in the credits: A Film By VIKTOR TARANSKY Still no one moves from their seats.  Viktor cannot stand it any longer.  He runs to the restroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face over the stained sink, VIKTOR splashes himself with water.  He looks to the mirror, horrified by his own reflection.  He rehearses a courtroom speech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, I may be guilty of a crime, but it was committed with the purest of intentions, to send a message to the acting community who put themselves above the work and above -- Three AUDIENCE MEMBERS enter the restroom.  They approach the urinals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So fake.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the winner is... Hal tears the envelope's seal, momentarily confused as he reads the name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, there's a tie. The AUDIENCE gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The winners are... Simone for "Sunrise, Sunset"... The audience cheers enthusiastically, but Hal stills their applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and Simone for "Eternity Forever". The audience erupts.  Viktor accepts the congratulations of those around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately, Simone can't be with us tonight. (turning to the screen) But thanks to the miracle of modern technology she is able to join us live via satellite from the location of her new film. The screen flickers to life.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (milking the moment for all it's worth)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - A DESOLATE WASTELAND - DAY SIMONE sits in a director's chair in the desolate wasteland location chosen by Viktor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you!  Thank you!  This means so much to me.  I'm just sorry I can't be there with you. (wiping away a tear) First off I have to acknowledge my fellow nominees -- I don't even feel I belong in the best actress category let alone with these... wonderful human beings. (composing herself) I also have to thank my co-stars, the studio, of course.  But most of all, I have to thank the audience for supporting what I do -- you're the only reason I'm here. The CROWD applauds wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is puzzled.  She leans over to Viktor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't she thank you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She did... didn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Viktor glances to the "Simone" sign beside him.  The blood drains from his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the monitor, SIMONE reads the forgotten line from the speech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And of course I must thank my collaborator, Viktor Taransky, without whom none of this would be possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still in his tuxedo, stares at SIMONE on the screen. He holds the text of Simone's acceptance speech in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's written right there... Why didn't I say it?... How could I forget to say it? Simone stares back at him blankly. A copy of VARIETY is slid under the soundstage door.  The front page headline, "NO THANK YOU - Simone Snubs Taransky At Oscars".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls up to the gate of his Malibu home.  MAX is standing outside next to his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  VIKTOR'S MALIBU HOME - NIGHT VIKTOR also spies an OLD WOMAN in a wheelchair sitting beside the car, MILTON closeby.  Viktor stops at the gate and reluctantly exits his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now, Sayer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks familiar, doesn't she?  No one comes from nowhere, Taransky. You turn over enough rocks... The old woman appears drugged, stares into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I traced her to a nursing home.  A young woman fitting Simone's description dropped her off five years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks a lot like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't uttered a word that whole time -- until she saw the big show. Max produces a shot of SIMONE at the Oscars and holds it in front of the old lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My baby... My baby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who would think that "Saint Simone" would abandon her own mother?  I've been looking into the family history -- heartbreaking.  Most likely a biography to run over four issues... who knows, maybe there's a Pulitzer in there somewhere. Viktor produces his own driver's license and holds it in front of the old lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My baby... My baby... Max hastily steps between Viktor and the Old Lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't prove a thing -- wait until I get a court order for a blood test.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That won't be necessary. (pretending to be resigned) Sooner or later I knew you'd crack this thing, Max.  You got me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do? (recovering) Sure I do. (taking Viktor aside) Can we speak off the record?  I'm a fair man.  I'm willing to sit down with her and tell her side of the story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't want you to compromise your ethics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Thanks.  Absolutely. Viktor regards the newshound with a look of pity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You love her, don't you, Max?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This should take care of Mother. Viktor drives into his home.  Max, very confused, stares at the old lady.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smug smile, noticing Viktor noticing the woman)

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to Viktor's face on the driver's license)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (writes a check, hands it to Max)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: escorts LAINEY, blindfolded, around the corner of his soundstage.  He removes the blindfold.  From Lainey's point- of-view we see the sportscar Simone drove in "ETERNITY FOREVER" -- the car tied with a bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy birthday, Lainey.  Do you like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fantastic -- it's too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the car she drove in "Eternity Forever".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  Thank her for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's from both of us.  Of course you'll have to drive it around the lot until you get your permit -- Lainey averts her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't accept it.  I don't want a car, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?  I can get you something else.  What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old Viktor Taransky. (finally blurting it out) I liked you better before -- before all this.  You were a loser, Dad, but at least you had integrity.  I can't stand to see you like this -- clinging to Simone's coattails -- it used to be about the work, and now it's all about her.  And then she's not even grateful enough to thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that was me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go again, blaming yourself.  Can't you see what she's done to you -- she's taking advantage, mocking you.  You deserve better than Simone. (hasty exit) I've got to go, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lainey... Viktor watches Lainey depart towards the studio gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY VIKTOR leans on his desk, still reflecting on LAINEY's remarks.  JANE enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready for your casting session? Viktor nods distractedly.  Jane shows in NICOLA ANDERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicola's here for the role of Simone's sister. Viktor offers Nicola a seat, staring at her as if he has never truly looked at her before -- she has a quality of Simone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot's happened since we last saw each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never apologized properly for what happened on "Sunrise". She hands Viktor a peace offering -- a large jar of Mike & Ike candy, including cherry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  It's not important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After I saw what Simone did with the role -- you know I fired all my people, went into rehab, took acting classes, changed my whole look.  She really inspired me. Viktor continues to stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like me to read?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'd like that. Nicola glances at the script a last time and puts it down. She approaches Viktor, standing close to him, playing the scene to him -- an immediate intimacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think you are, Carlos
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coming in here like this?  With my husband sleeping in the next room.  Do you think I won't call out?  Do you think I will just give in to you without a fight -- like the last time and the time before that? (she kisses his ear) I wish you were dead. (she kisses his lips) I wish we were both dead. Nicola immediately breaks character. Viktor is mesmerized -- he has fallen back in love with flesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know you're really very good. I take back what I said.  I mean, you're really good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could play the lead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's Simone's part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course it is. (gazing at her face) You know you have a line here.  Not a wrinkle.  Actually, more of a dimple.  I've been thinking of incorporating something like that in Simone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd cosmetically alter Simone to look like me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, of course not, you're right. That would be crazy. Viktor sits back down and stares out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want me to do it again? Viktor does not reply.  Nicola quietly leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (referring to the script in her hands)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (her angry words are in opposition to her amorous actions)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The front page of "Variety" is dominated by a large photograph of SIMONE giving her acceptance speech via satellite.  However, ELAINE is gazing at a small inset picture of VIKTOR, HERSELF and LAINEY arriving at the Oscar Ceremony. Elaine tears out the photo and slips it into her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old home video of ELAINE.  She is in a garden by a swimming pool, laughing, waving and sweetly flirting with the camera. Elaine raises her skirt teasingly, winks, gestures the camera operator towards her with a beckoning finger, finally blows a kiss to the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While the ever-seductive SIMONE waits patiently on-screen for Viktor's instructions, VIKTOR is gazing at the smaller monitor -- the home video of ELAINE. Viktor freezes the tape.  Elaine appears particularly beautiful. Viktor electronically cuts out Elaine's mannerism and morphs it into Simone.  Now Simone blows the kiss and has the same dazzling smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & VIKTOR'S OFFICE - DAY At her desk, JANE is busy trying to mimic Simone's hairstyle as she talks on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sure, she comes in all the time... we've become close.  She told me -- VIKTOR enters the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane -- Jane hurriedly hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving early tonight.  If you need me I'll be at the beach house having dinner with a... certain someone. Jane tries to conceal her interest.  As soon as Viktor exits the office, JANE picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Elaine Christian please. We reveal VIKTOR, outside the door, eavesdropping on his assistant, pleased she has taken the bait.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (picking up a pile of scripts from the in-tray)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: dims the lights, plays "mood" music.  The doorbell rings. He checks himself in the mirror.  In the reflection, he spies an autographed photo of HIMSELF with his arm around SIMONE. He hurriedly hides the photo and answers the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viktor, I'm picking up Lainey. Elaine is over-dressed for her supposed errand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elaine, it's Wednesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it Wednesday?  It's Wednesday. How embarrassing.  I don't know what I was thinking.  With all the excitement lately... (peering past him) Am I interrupting something?  Are you expecting company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a matter-of-fact I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When is she coming over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About now.  Would you like a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose I could stay, just until she arrives. Elaine takes a seat on the sofa.  Viktor hands her a glass of wine and sits beside her -- close. They both knock back their wine in one long gulp, both apparently in need of courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Simone back to earth yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not quite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you'll keep her focussed. She's lucky to have you, Viktor. (blurting out) Is she really having your baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just read somewhere -- VIKTOR I know.  I know.  They'll say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she was positively glowing at the awards. (making to leave) I should be going, she'll be here soon -- Viktor puts his finger to her lips to hush her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She already is.  Simone's not coming over, Elaine.  Not tonight, not ever. (holding her) I want you back, Elaine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you back too, Viktor. They kiss.  Elaine breaks the kiss, suddenly consumed with doubt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is crazy.  Who am I fooling? I can't compete with Simone.  What woman can?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would rather have you than Simone.  Believe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's sweet, Viktor, but I couldn't let you do that -- make that kind of sacrifice. (meeting his gaze) It's strange.  I've stabbed people in the back, clawed and slept my way to where I am -- it goes with the territory -- but, for some reason, I can't betray Simone. There's... I don't know any other way to say it -- there's a goodness to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, there isn't.  There's nothing to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Viktor.  You say that now -- because we're here, alone, like this.  But in the morning, you'd go back to her.  What man wouldn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I will end my relationship with her -- totally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you don't understand.  She'll always be there -- at some party, on some magazine cover, some song on the radio, up on some screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  She'll never work again -- retire, never make a movie or a record, or appear ever again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course she will.  Her public will demand it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if I don't let her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You? Viktor knocks back another glass of wine for courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to tell you a secret now, Elaine. (mustering all his nerve) Simone is not a real person.  I invented her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every actor is an invention, Viktor.  Don't embarrass yourself. No one's denying that you discovered Simone.  But it's like finding a diamond in the desert. Anyone can trip over it, but it's not the finder who sparkles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I didn't trip over her. You don't understand -- ELAINE (ignoring him)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just got lucky that she's loyal enough to stay with you. Maybe she's staying out of pity, who knows?  She certainly doesn't need you.  Some people even say you're holding her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who says that -- ? (shaking off the insult)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind.  You have to listen to me, Elaine.  Simone is thin air, pixels, molded by me from a mathematical equation.  I inherited it from a madman -- I can show you -- ELAINE How much wine have you had?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a figment of my own imagination.  I, Viktor Taransky, have perpetrated the greatest hoax, the greatest sleight-of-hand, sleight-of-mouth, sleight-of- sleight in entertainment history! And still no one appreciates me, recognizes what I've done -- even you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're drunker than I thought.  Are you doing that again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  Whatever talent Simone has comes from me -- me!  Me!  I swear, as God is my judge.  You don't know what I've been through.  Tens of thousands of mind-numbing hours in front of that screen, nights without end, and look what it's cost me. (producing his spectacles) Why do you think I've been wearing these?  I may have done irreparable harm to my eyesight, and why?  To extract and refine the infinite nuances of a human being -- a human soul. (a final explanation) Don't you see?  I made Simone! A pause.  His words hang in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made Simone? (a trace of pity) Viktor, she made you. Elaine gets up and walks out, leaving the distraught Viktor alone in his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hung-over VIKTOR enters his office.  Suddenly, he stops and confronts the standee of SIMONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bitch!  I'll destroy you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares in shock.  She discreetly exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in front of his monitor, smiling venomously at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  He begins to digitally disrobe Simone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A)  Peering through a gap in the drapes of his Malibu house,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches MAX dig through his trash.  Max finds a beat up reel of 16mm film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the end up to the light -- his eyes pop. B)  The ECHO headline screams, "SIMONE'S HARD CORE PAST" and shows censored film frames of a naked Simone in a compromising position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hovering at a supermarket check-out line, overhears two WOMEN discussing the article.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disgusting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She must have been so desperate to do something like that, so depraved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still naming my baby after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're having a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? Viktor blanches.  It is not the reaction he'd hoped for. C)  Inside a theater, VIKTOR hovers by the door, smirking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we hear a farmyard scene -- SIMONE in an empty farmyard on all fours, grunting like a pig, and foraging for muddy vegetables. The AUDIENCE is shocked, then suddenly breaks into spontaneous applause. Viktor, enraged, exits into the lobby past the poster for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Starring Simone". D)  A pretentious FILM CRITIC talks to camera, a film poster behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Simone to do something as brave as "I AM PIG" at this point in her career, with so much to lose -- all I can say is, "I Am Pig, I Am Oscar". E)  In his soundstage, VIKTOR moves a slider that adds wrinkles to Simone. F)  SIMONE appears on a morning talk show -- as usual, remote on a TV screen.  However, her squeaky-clean image has gone -- hair unkempt, bloated, chain-smoking and drinking during the interview.  The HOSTS are smiling weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simone, that's a rather controversial position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just think all elementary schools should have a firing range -- so students can learn how to defend themselves.  We could fit it inbetween recess and American History. Another clip:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's a hole in the ozone layer why can't I see it? Another clip:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Immigration?!  God, isn't it crowded enough?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as we always knew.  Simone's not like other celebrities.  She speaks her mind! G)  VIKTOR driving along a city street, suddenly slams on his brakes, almost causing an accident.  He stares numbly up at a twenty-foot high smiling photo of Simone on a billboard featuring a huge cover of TIME MAGAZINE.  It reads, "SIMONE: WOMAN OF THE YEAR".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's trying to kill me. Realizing what he's said, a thought comes into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An inscription on a headstone reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kneels at HANK's grave.  He places a bunch of flowers there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're plastic, Hank.  I know that's the way you'd want it. (glancing to a Simone billboard outside the cemetery wall) She killed you, Hank.  Now she's killing me.  She's a serial killer. (ducking out of sight of the billboard as if Simone is watching him) But I don't know how to stop her. She's taken on a life of her own. I can't just come clean -- make some confession.  I've defrauded millions -- they'd turn on me.  And I can't put the genie back in the bottle.  If she stopped working -- dropped out of sight, they'd never let it rest.  I've tried to kill her career but they like her even more. (more desperate) What am I going to do, Hank? A thought occurs to Viktor.  He slowly rises from behind Hank's headstone, revealing a forest of headstones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say another word, Hank.  You are truly a genius.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sad but resolute VIKTOR sits in front of his monitor, SIMONE's face full screen. He speaks into the voice synthesizer, Simone's face automatically speaking the words he speaks -- the final time he puts his words in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, Viktor?  You look so sad.  Don't you love me anymore?... It's over, isn't it? He switches off the synthesizer and speaks in his own voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only way, Simone.  If it's any consolation, you're going to live on in the public's heart like all the other tragic figures that went before their time.  There's no love like posthumous love. On the screen, Simone is on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you're thinking.  It's a phoney-baloney world.  The women are surgically enhanced, the athletes are on steroids, the singers are lip-syncing if they're even singing at all, the news is entertainment, the politicians are bought and paid for -- we're living one big lie.  So why shouldn't you live too?  You're more authentic than the people who adore you. (a trace of despair) And that's the problem.  You're looking at the real fraud.  I told myself this was all about the work but if that was the truth, it wouldn't matter to me -- and it does.  It wasn't that the artists had no respect for the art.  They had no respect for me.  Someone like you, you have so much love showered on you -- I just wanted to feel one tiny drop on my face.  I'm sorry, Simone.  Here I've been trying to convince the world that you exist, but I was really trying to convince them that I exist. It's not that you aren't human, Simone, it's that I am. Viktor produces a disc from his jacket marked, "PLAGUE - Ver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .1".  He places the disc in the machine. Viktor sees that Simone is crying.  He touches a tear on his own face and realizes her tears are in response to his own. Viktor hesitates -- a moment of doubt -- then presses
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  The image of SIMONE's face gradually begins to deconstruct -- pixel by pixel -- as the virus takes hold. The pixels collect into a pile at the bottom of his screen like dust.  Finally, the dust is blown away in a single digital breath. For a moment his attention is taken with a layer of dust on his own desk. Viktor regards his own reflection in the now black screen. His hard-drive now corrupted, he picks up his original disc marked, "SIMULATION ONE". He tosses this disc into a steamer trunk he has loaded with hundreds of discs relating to Simone's software.  He shuts the lid and begins dragging the trunk towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viktor's yacht sits at anchor in the glassy waters of Santa Monica Bay -- "SIMONE" written on the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: manhandles the trunk to the railing.  A mournful pause
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then he heaves it over the side.  The trunk sinks like a stone. Heart heavy, Viktor stares into the inky depths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A throng of REPORTERS and CAMERA CREWS.  A somber VIKTOR enters and takes a seat in front of a forest of microphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is my sad and solemn duty to announce the tragic passing of Simone. A gasp from the audience.  Then, an explosion of anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!  What happened?!  Oh.  God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did she die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rare virus. (pretending to compose himself) On her goodwill tour of the third world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she suffer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercifully, it was quick. At the back of the room are MAX SAYER and MILTON.  They are frozen in grief, a tear spills from Max's eye.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (stepping forward, mustering the courage to ask the question)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : A)  "SIMON GONE - FADE TO BLACK", reads the cover of Variety. B)  The announcement of her death appears on local TV news shows around the globe. C)  A carpet of bouquets and notes of commiseration several yards wide completely surrounds Viktor's property including the driveway.  VIKTOR insensitively drives over the bouquets to the horror of the MOURNERS, including MAX SAYER and MILTON. D)  In a remote Mongolian encampment MONGOL HORSEMEN crowd around a television showing a live picture of Simone's funeral. E)  The HEARSE carrying Simone's "body" and the funeral procession led solemnly by VIKTOR, proceeds through the studio lot.  Distraught STUDIO STAFF toss flowers onto the hearse. F)  The same television picture is playing on a television sitting on a stool in a WEST AFRICAN river.  LOCAL WOMEN stop washing their clothes to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We tilt up from Hank's headstone to an ornate mausoleum on an island in a lake. Simone's coffin is ferried across a bridge by PALLBEARERS from the studio.  Numerous MOURNERS follow behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and a curiously dry-eyed LAINEY walk behind the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see you later -- go away for the weekend?
direction.name: direction
